        public java.lang.String getUserString(java.lang.String msg)

      • getUserInteger

        public int getUserInteger(java.lang.String msg,
                          int min,
                          int max)
        Displays a message for the user and a textfield for the user to fill out. Only numbers are allowed if the number isn't in range the user can't press OK.
        Is a breaking call.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message for the user.
        min - The low end of the valid range (inclusive).
        max - The high end of the valid range (inclusive).
        Returns:
        The number entered by the user.

      • getUserButtonPressed

        public java.lang.String getUserButtonPressed(java.lang.String msg,
                                             java.lang.String... buttonTexts)
        Displays a message for the user along with a row of buttons.
        Is a breaking call.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message for the user.
        buttonTexts - The labels on the buttons.
        Returns:
        The label of the button pressed by the user.

      • getUserSelection

        public java.lang.String getUserSelection(java.lang.String msg,
                                         java.lang.String... options)
        Displays a message and a drop-down menu with option for the user.
        Is a breaking call.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message for the user
        options - The options the user can choose from
        Returns:
        The selected option

      • addPlayer

        public boolean addPlayer(GUI_Player player)
        Adds a player to the board.
        A new player with the same color will replace the old.
        Max. 6 players.
        Parameters:
        player - : The player must be created beforehand
        Returns:
        true if player is added, otherwise false

      • setDice

        public void setDice(int faceValue1,
                    int faceValue2)
        Shows two dice on the board. The dice will have the specified values, but the placement is random.
        Parameters:
        faceValue1 - : int [1:6]
        faceValue2 - : int [1:6]
        (If a faceValue is out of bounds nothing will happen!)

      • setDice

                    int x1,
                    int y1,
                    int faceValue2,
                    int x2,
                    int y2)
        Shows two dice on the board. The dice will have the specified values and location.
        Parameters:
        faceValue1 - : int [1:6]
        x1 - : int [0:10]
        y1 - : int [0:10]
        faceValue2 - : int [1:6]
        x2 - : int [0:10]
        y2 - : int [0:10]

      • setDice

        public void setDice(int faceValue1,
                    int rotation1,
                    int faceValue2,
                    int rotation2)
        Shows two dice on the board. The dice will have the specified values, but the placement is random.
        Parameters:
        faceValue1 - : int [1:6]
        rotation1 - : int [0:2]
        faceValue2 - : int [1:6]
        rotation2 - : int [0:2]
        (If a faceValue is out of bounds nothing will happen!)
